intro: Heptapleurum baikiei, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to China, particularly in the provinces of Hubei, Sichuan, and Yunnan, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, glossy dark green foliage and its ability to produce small, white flowers followed by red berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and air-purifying qualities. Heptapleurum baikiei is also valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
